thread.title: XOLO Era 2X with 5-inch display, 16GB storage and VoLTE launched, price starts at Rs 6,666
thread.title_full: XOLO Era 2X with 5-inch display, 16GB storage and VoLTE launched, price starts at Rs 6,666

title: XOLO Era 2X with 5-inch display, 16GB storage and VoLTE launched, price starts at Rs 6,666
text:
XOLO Era 2X with 5-inch display, 16GB storage and VoLTE launched, price... XOLO Era 2X with 5-inch display, 16GB storage and VoLTE launched, price starts at Rs 6,666 By - January 5, 2017 “The Era 2X features a quad-core SoC, up to 3GB of RAM, 8MP/5MP cameras, and a 2,500mAh battery” 
In October last year, XOLO launched the budget Era 2 Android smartphone for Rs 4,499. Today, at an event in New Delhi, the company has launched the successor to the Era 2 called the Era 2X. Similar to its predecessor, the Era 2X is also a budget smartphone featuring 4G with VoLTE support. The phone also comes with a fingerprint sensor located at its rear, which was missing on its predecessor. 
The XOLO Era 2X features a 5-inch HD Oncell IPS display, and boots Android 6.0 Marshmallow. It is powered by a 1.25GHz quad-core MediaTek processor. The phone comes in two RAM configurations – 2GB and 3GB. It offers 16GB of internal storage, which is further expandable up to 32GB by inserting a microSD card. 
The XOLO Era 2X features an 8-megapixel primary shooter with an LED flash, 5P Largan lens, and a blue glass filter. For selfies and video calling, it gets a 5-megapixel front snapper with a screen flash feature. Apart from VoLTE, its other connectivity features include dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and GPS. A 2,500mAh battery keeps the phone running. 
The XOLO Era 2X’s 2GB RAM variant has been priced at Rs 6,666, while the 3GB model will set you back by Rs 7,499. The phone will be available exclusively on Flipkart in Black Gunmetal and Latte Gold hues starting from January 9th. Facebook Comments
